title: Which NFL teams could change QBs next year? 12 situations to watch -- and possible options for each
content: We picked teams with some level of QB1 uncertainty for 2026 and projected two potential outcomes for each: one likely, one not so likely.

title: Agent unsure of Richardson's future with Colts
content: Anthony Richardson Sr.'s agent reacted with disappointment with the Colts' decision to name Daniel Jones the starting quarterback and said he's unsure of his client's future with the team.

title: Yanks make history with 2nd 9-HR game of season
content: After a lengthy rain delay, Giancarlo Stanton hit two home runs and the Yankees matched a franchise record with nine long balls Tuesday night in a convincing 13-3 victory over the Rays, an effort the slugger labeled as "awesome to see."

title: Saints QB competition to continue, Moore says
content: The Saints are taking their quarterback decision down to the wire, with coach Kellen Moore saying they want to continue the competition between Tyler Shough and Spencer Rattler through next week.

title: Texas QB Manning says future plans still unclear
content: Texas quarterback Arch Manning says his playing future -- whether it's remaining with the Longhorns after this season or entering the NFL draft -- has yet to be decided despite recent comments by his grandfather Archie Manning.

title: Royals' Witt joins elite company with 100th HR
content: Royals shortstop Bobby Witt Jr. hit his 100th career home run Tuesday, becoming the youngest player in franchise history to reach that mark.

title: Robles suspended 10 games, fined for bat heave
content: Victor Robles has received a 10-game suspension and an undisclosed fine for throwing his bat at a Triple-A pitcher Sunday.

title: ChÃ¡vez deported to Mexico for alleged cartel ties
content: Julio CÃ©sar ChÃ¡vez Jr., 39, arrested days after his fight with Jake Paul, has been deported to Mexico, where he's wanted for alleged cartel ties, following his detention in the U.S. for allegedly overstaying his visa and lying on a green card application.

title: Rory: Took home 1,100 Masters flags after win
content: Rory McIlroy said he took all 1,100 pin flags from the Masters Shop after winning at Augusta National in April. "I've waited 17 years to sign that flag in the middle, and I will never complain about doing it."

title: ðŸ‘€ Indiana's mascot resurrected after 50 years!
content: Indiana's original bison mascot was described as "the devil with a cheerleader in it" -- but now a new version has risen from the ashes thanks to a passionate professor, underground student government action, a campus bar and more.

title: Yates' preseason NFL mock draft for 2026: Six first-round quarterbacks? A pair of early trades?
content: Could Arch Manning go No. 1? Will QBs dominate the first round? Which teams could land playmakers? Field Yates projects next year's opening 32 picks.

title: Are the Colts, Anthony Richardson headed for a breakup? Is there a trade market? What's next?
content: Naming Daniel Jones the starter might have irrevocably damaged the relationship between the Colts and Richardson? Here's what to know.

title: Can DJ Lagway become Florida's next great quarterback?
content: In his sophomore season, the signal-caller will try to lead Florida to its first College Football Playoff appearance.

title: Burrow, McConkey among Matt Bowen's top 10 draft targets, Warren among late fliers
content: Matt Bowen ranks the most common players he has been drafting this summer and includes a handful of late-rounders to put on the radar.

title: Cam Ward, Brian Callahan and the Tennessee Titans' historically worrying challenge
content: The past two No. 1 picks have seen their coaches fired in November. How will Cam Ward (and Brian Callahan) avoid the same fate?

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Should the Dream be considered title contenders?
content: Atlanta will be pressure-tested against the league's best teams this week, starting with a red-hot Las Vegas.

title: 'We know how to weather storms': How the Aces saved their season
content: Las Vegas, .500 at the All-Star break, has won seven straight and is vying to host early WNBA playoff games.

content: Milwaukee is on fire. New York is ice cold. Top players are hurt or struggling. Here's what it all means.

title: What makes Tarik Skubal and Paul Skenes the best pitchers on the planet
content: Here's what separates the Cy Young favorites from other aces, according to those who watch them most.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool ready Â£130m move for Isak
content: Liverpool have sanctioned a Â£130m move to land Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: The little-known FIFA rule that gives Isak all the leverage over Newcastle
content: Breaking down a little-known FIFA rule called Article 17. It could be the key to unlocking Isak's future.

title: Who could be the breakout U21 player on each Premier League club?
content: With a host of young players impressing in preseason, we look at the next breakout stars under the age of 21 from all 20 Premier League teams.

content: From Lionel Messi to Son Heung-Min, how do MLS teams know when signing a close-to-retirement star from Europe is a good idea?

content: Important milestones to watch ahead of the 2025-26 season, including another historic season from LeBron James and Nikola Jokic.

title: AFC East betting preview: Bills odds-on favorite to take division
content: Can anyone keep up with the Bills in the AFC East? Here are all the odds for each team in the division and our favorite bets.

title: Florida announces retro uniforms for homecoming game against Mississippi State
content: Last worn in 2021, the Gators' throwback threads offer a simplistic twist on the school's iconic blue and orange color scheme.

title: Jalen Brunson, Natalia Bryant star together in new Nike Kobe sneaker ad
content: A key feature of the new Nike Kobe 3 Protro is diamond shapes on the upper and outsole in honor of Natalia.

title: Answering the biggest questions facing Keegan Bradley with six U.S. Ryder Cup spots left
content: Will Bradley choose himself to play at ? Who are locks to make the team? We answer some of the biggest questions with six captain's picks left to fill out the team.

title: 'You felt the momentum change': Michael Vick's early impact at Norfolk State
content: Vick is coaching just 30 miles from where he grew up, and in the state where he electrified college football as a player.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: San Diego becomes KC's closest challenger
content: Kansas City is all alone out front, but the fight for second? That's headed by San Diego in ESPN's latest NWSL Power Rankings.

title: How will Xabi Alonso handle LaLiga refereeing at Real Madrid?
content: As Real Madrid's new manager, Alonso will soon be exposed to the eccentricities of refereeing in LaLiga.

title: Inside ISRO's Busy Schedule To Redefine India In Space
content: After the remarkable success of astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's 18-day mission to the International Space Station, the Indian space agency has a busy year ahead.

title: Opposition Shreds Bill To Sack Arrested Ministers, Throws It At Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has introduced a controversial law in Lok Sabha under which the Prime Minister and Chief Ministers of states can be removed from office if they are in jail for 30 days, even if they are not convicted of the crime.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Live Updates: 3 Bills Introduced By Amit Shah To Be Sent To Joint Parliamentary Committee
content: Home Minister Amit Shah introduced three bills - The Government of Union Territories (Amendment) Bill 2025, the Constitution (One Hundred And Thirtieth Amendment) Bill 2025, and the Jammu and Kashmir Reorganisation (Amendment) Bill 2025.

title: "No Personal Attack, Veep Polls Decent Contest": Opposition Nominee To NDTV
content: A narrative is being set that the Vice-Presidential election has pitted Telangana against Tamil Nadu, said the Opposition's nominee and retired Supreme Court judge Justice B Sudershan Reddy.

title: "Feels Like Failure": Doctor Gives 4 Years To Exam Prep, Faces 65% Pay Cut
content: A doctor has opened up about the toll of spending years in academic preparation, only to see a drastic fall in his earnings.

title: CM Rekha Gupta Attacked LIVE Updates: Police Registers Case Of Attempt To Murder After Attack On Rekha Gupta
content: Attack on CM Rekha GuptaÂ Live News: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta was allegedly attacked during a "Jan Sunwai" programme on Thursday morning, police said, adding that the accused has been caught and is being questioned.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Planes, Films With Bachchans, Lucknow: Growing Up As Rajiv Gandhi
content: On Rajiv Gandhi's 81st birth anniversary, noted columnist Rasheed Kidwai looks at the world of the Gandhis, beyond politics

title: Video: Day Before Assault, Rekha Gupta Attacker Visited Her Ancestral House
content: The accused behind the attack on Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta had recced her ancestral residence in Shalimar Bagh area on Tuesday, CCTV footage showed on Wednesday.

title: Marriage Pressure Led Madhya Pradesh Lawyer To Fake Her Own Disappearance: Police
content: The mysterious disappearance of Archana Tiwari, a civil judge aspirant and practising lawyer, has culminated in a dramatic recovery and a web of deception that stunned investigators.

title: Man Who Attacked Delhi Chief Minister A Dog Lover, Was Upset, Claims Mother
content: The man who attacked Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta has been identified as Rajesh Sakaria, originally from Rajkot in Gujarat

title: "If India Refuses Russian Oil...": What Moscow Official Said On Trump Tariff
content: India is welcome to export its products to Russia if it is facing trouble entering the US market, a senior Russian diplomat said on Wednesday.

title: Lucknow Lawyer Gets Life Sentence For Filing Fake Cases By Misusing Dalit Woman's Identity
content: A special court here has sentenced an advocate to life imprisonment and imposed a fine of Rs 5.10 lakh after finding him guilty of misusing the identity of a Dalit woman to file dozens of fake cases against his opponents .

title: Class 10 Student Stabbed To Death By Junior, Massive Protests In Gujarat
content: A class 10 student from Ahmedabad died of his injuries a day after he was stabbed by a junior following an altercation. The news of the death has sparked intense anger among parents and the local community, leading to protests outside the school.

title: Himachal Pradesh Monsoon Leaves 276 Dead, 336 Injured, 37 Missing So Far
content: The monsoon's fury in Himachal Pradesh has left 276 people dead since June 20, with 143 fatalities caused by rain-related incidents such as landslides, flash floods, cloudbursts, drowning, electrocution, and falls from steep slopes.

title: 10-Foot-Long Rock Python Rescued From Housing Society In Mumbai
content: A 10-foot-long Indian Rock Python strayed into a residential premises in Mumbai's Mulund area, causing panic among people, a wildlife welfare organisation said.

title: Death Count In Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Floods Rises To 365, Rescue Efforts Underway
content: The death toll in the flood-ravaged province of Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) has surged to 365, as torrential rains and flash floods continue to batter the region, with new casualties and destruction reported across several districts.

title: Centre Makes Raw Cotton Import Duty-Free Till September 30 To Support Textile Sector
content: The Centre has temporarily scrapped the 11% duty on raw cotton imports until September 30, seeking to cool prices and ease cost pressures on the textile industry at a time when exporters face mounting tariff barriers abroad.

title: Trinamool Leader Sues RG Kar Rape-Murder Victim's Father For Defamation
content: A senior Trinamool Congress leader has filed a defamation case against the father of the 34-year-old doctor, who was raped and murdered at Kolkata's RG Kar Medical College and Hospital last year

title: Australia Chides Israel After Diplomats' Visas Revoked
content: Australia's foreign minister criticised Israel for revoking visas held by Canberra's diplomatic representatives to the Palestinian Authority.

title: 'Naidu, Nitish most fearful': Raut's big claim on govt's 'removing PM, CMs' bill
content: Sanjay Raut claims the Centre introduced new bills to deter Nitish Kumar and Chandrababu Naidu from withdrawing support to the NDA government, fearing their opposition to provisions allowing the removal of leaders arrested for serious crimes.

title: Attack on Delhi CM: Attempt to murder case filed; accused caught on cam
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta was attacked during a Jan Sunvai, prompting immediate police action and a medical examination for Gupta. The assailant, identified as Rajesh Khimji, had previously been seen surveilling Gupta's residence. While the accused is in custody and his background is being verified, Gupta's condition is stable, and she intends to continue her scheduled programs.

title: 'Moment of pride': Shah approves name change; Jalalabad to be now called ...
content: The Union Home Minister, Amit Shah, has approved the renaming of Jalalabad in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur district to Parshurampuri. This decision follows a letter sent to the state's Chief Secretary, indicating the central government's approval.

title: Asia Cup | 'Seems strange': Ex-India batter slams Shreyas Iyerâ€™s exclusion
content: Robin Uthappa has voiced his surprise over Shreyas Iyer's omission from India's Asia Cup squad, despite Iyer's strong performances, including being the leading run-scorer in the Champions Trophy and guiding his IPL teams to successive finals. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar defended the decision, citing squad size limitations.

title: Foxconn shift: No longer Appleâ€™s iPhone factory floor; now building this AI technology
content: Foxconn, known for iPhone production, is changing its business. The company is now focusing on artificial intelligence. It is building AI servers for cloud computing and generative AI. Demand for AI infrastructure is increasing. Foxconn is partnering with Nvidia, Supermicro, and Dell. This move positions Foxconn as a key player in enterprise hardware.

title: Infosys hands out higher bonus! Employees get average 80% payout
content: Infosys has distributed performance bonuses for the April-June quarter to eligible employees, with payouts averaging 80% and ranging from 75-89%. This marks an improvement compared to the previous quarter's disbursement.

title: Want to live longer? Research says THIS simple habit adds years to life
content: At 100 years old, Ruth exemplifies the benefits of exercise in old age, routinely walking four miles daily. Her dedication, along with a healthy diet and ample sleep, inspires others to prioritize their well-being. Research supports her lifestyle, highlighting walking's role in preventing age-related diseases and promoting overall health, proving it's never too late to start.

title: Kambli health update | 'He needs your love and support': Brother hopeful of recovery
content: Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli is facing health challenges, battling a urinary infection and speech difficulties. His brother, Virendra, shared an emotional update, revealing Kambli's slow recovery and ongoing treatment after a recent hospital stay. Despite financial struggles and personal challenges, Kambli's family remains his strongest support.

title: Google Pixel 10 series launch event today: Timings, where to watch
content: Google is set to unveil its Pixel 10 series at today's 'Made by Google' event, featuring the Pixel 10, Pro, Pro XL, and Pro Fold models. These phones are rumored to be powered by the Tensor G5 chipset and boast enhanced AI capabilities.

title: Stephen A. Smith defends Trump; points to Biden for Ukraine-Russia conflict
content: Stephen A. Smith, on his podcast, defended Donald Trump, asserting he didn't initiate the Russia-Ukraine war. Smith argued that Joe Biden, as president during the full-scale conflict, bears responsibility. He further contended that decisions by Barack Obama, regarding Crimea, and Bill Clinton, concerning Ukraine's nuclear disarmament, contributed to the current crisis, emphasizing the importance of upholding promises to Ukraine.

title: â€˜Rockets to Wall Streetâ€™: Muskâ€™s teen prodigy leaves SpaceX; joins Citadel Securities
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old prodigy who previously worked at SpaceX, is now joining Citadel Securities as a developer in New York City. He chose the quantitative trading firm over AI labs and big tech companies, drawn to the fast-paced environment and intellectual challenges. Quazi will be working on global trading infrastructure, embracing Wall Street's meritocratic culture.

title: Spying for Pakistan: Man detained in Jaisalmer; 4th case from district
content: In Jaisalmer, a 30-year-old man named Jivan Khan has been detained on suspicion of spying for Pakistan. Military Intelligence apprehended Khan, who previously worked at a restaurant within the military area, after he attempted to enter an Army station. Questioning revealed he has relatives in Pakistan.

title: 'If Indian goods can't go to US, they can ...': Russia slams Trump tariffs; calls pressure over oil 'unjustified'
content: Prime Minister Modi and Russian President Putin are scheduled to meet in New Delhi to bolster trade ties, focusing on improved payment systems and the removal of trade barriers. Russia aims to strengthen its economic partnership with India amidst global challenges.

title: Chess | Drama! Dutch No 1 Anish Giri blocks Carlsen's long-time coach on social media
content: A social media clash erupted between Anish Giri and Peter Heine Nielsen after Giri commented on D Gukesh's drawing tendencies. Nielsen criticised Giri's view on player mentality, sparking a heated exchange where Giri referenced Carlsen's playing style and Nielsen's alleged bias. Despite the feud, Giri remains in strong form, recently finishing as runner-up in the Chennai Grand Masters 2025.

title: 'War 2' box office collection day 7: Film to cross Rs 200 crore in India
content: Released on August 14th amidst a box office clash with 'Coolie,' 'War 2' initially lagged behind, earning Rs 51.5 crore on its opening day compared to 'Coolie's' Rs 65 crore. Despite decent weekend numbers, 'War 2' experienced a significant drop on Monday, its fifth day.

title: Cricket | Kohli, Rohit disappear from latest ODI rankings. What happened?
content: Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli had curiously dropped out of the latest ICC ODI rankings, with Shubman Gill in the lead among Indian batters. According to ICC rules, players are removed from rankings if they haven't played within a qualifying period, which is 9-12 months for ODIs.

title: French streamer Jean Pormanove dies at 46, fans outraged
content: French streamer Jean Pormanove, known for his extreme IRL broadcasts, tragically died at 46, sparking grief and outrage. His death followed a grueling Kick marathon, raising concerns about unsafe streaming culture. Fans are sharing disturbing clips, igniting debate on platform accountability and creator safety in the face of toxic content.

title: Upset over SC order on stray dogs? Man who 'attacked' Delhi CM did 'recce'; how incident unfolded
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta was allegedly attacked during her Jan Sunwai, causing chaos. A man, identified as Rajesh Bhai Khimji Bhai Sakriya, reportedly grabbed her hand, prompting immediate intervention by attendees and security. Virendra Sachdeva, Delhi BJP president, called it a security breach. Gupta, though in shock, is stable and committed to her work.

title: 'Bill to remove PM, CMs': Tharoor breaks from party line; calls proposal 'reasonable'
content: Shashi Tharoor supports the new bills regarding ministers' removal upon imprisonment. The bills propose removing ministers jailed for 30 days on serious charges. This stance differs from other Congress leaders like Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, who criticizes the bill. She calls it draconian and anti-democratic. The proposed law mandates resignation for PMs, CMs, and ministers detained for offenses with five-year sentences.

title: Over 7.6 lakh Indians went abroad in 2024: STEM courses lead
content: Over 7.6 lakh Indian students pursued global education in 2024, marking a slight decrease from 2023's 8.95 lakh. The US, Canada, and the UK remain top destinations, while Germany and Russia gain traction. STEM, AI, and business courses are highly sought after. Government initiatives like MRQs and the ICWF support students, but visa issues and rising costs pose challenges.

title: Online Gaming Bill tabled in Lok Sabha: Government cracks down on digital betting
content: The Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025, has been introduced in the Lok Sabha, aiming to regulate online gaming by banning real-money games while promoting e-sports and social games. The legislation seeks to protect youth from predatory apps and prevent addiction and financial risks.

title: What is PM Rozgar Yojana? How Rs 15,000 incentive scheme for employees works
content: The Narendra Modi government has launched the Pradhan Mantri Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana. This scheme aims to boost job creation and social security. The government will provide incentives up to Rs 15,000 for new employees registered with EPFO. Employers will also receive support for creating new jobs. The scheme aims to generate 3.5 crore employment opportunities.

title: Florida crash: Harjinder Singh, who killed 3, fails English, road tests
content: Harjinder Singh, an Indian immigrant trucker, faces charges for a fatal Florida crash after a reckless U-turn. Despite failing English and road sign tests, he obtained commercial driver's licenses in California and Washington. The incident has ignited a political clash between the Trump administration and California Governor Gavin Newsom over immigration and licensing policies, highlighting concerns about public safety.

title: Asia Cup: How six-hitting changed T20 cricket; Indiaâ€™s surge in the big-hit race
content: T20 cricket has undergone a six-hitting revolution, transforming batting from risk-averse accumulation to power-driven aggression. India, once lagging behind, now match the worldâ€™s best with a six every 12 balls in 2024. With IPL and internationals fuelling the trend, six-hitting is now the currency of modern T20 cricket.

title: FASTag Annual Pass: How to activate online via Rajmargyatra app
content: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) introduced the FASTag Annual Pass, streamlining toll payments for highway travelers. Over five lakh vehicle owners registered within days, benefiting from seamless, faster toll transactions. Initially for commercial vehicles, it now includes private vehicles, offering convenience, time-saving, and transparency with a fixed validity of one year or 200 trips.

title: Protest at Ahmedabad school: Class 10 student stabbed to death by junior; building ransacked
content: A Class 8 student in Ahmedabad tragically died after being stabbed during a fight with a Class 10 student at Seventh-Day Adventist School. The incident ignited protests by the victim's family, the Sindhi community, and other parents, who gathered at the school demanding action.

title: â€˜Lucky charmâ€™: How a Ukrainian designer styled Zelenskyy for Trump meeting
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with US President Donald Trump in a military-style attire designed by Viktor Anisimov, a subtle shift from his usual wartime look. Anisimov aimed to incorporate civilian elements, hoping it would serve as a 'lucky charm' for peace. Trump praised Zelenskyy's outfit, a contrast to a previous tense meeting.

title: Asia Cup: New fave in Indian cricket? Gill's elevation a natural progression
content: Shubman Gill's selection as T20 vice-captain for the Asia Cup reflects his consistent IPL performance and leadership qualities, solidifying his place in the squad. His elevation signals a strategic move by the BCCI, potentially positioning him as a future all-format captain and a key figure in Indian cricket's brand identity.

title: NCERT launches modules on Op Sindoor for class 3 to 12: Whatâ€™s in store for students
content: NCERT has introduced Operation Sindoor modules for classes 3-12, embedding lessons of courage and national pride into the curriculum. These modules detail the mission launched in response to the Pahalgam terror attack, showcasing India's military capabilities and the unity displayed across the nation. It highlights technological advancements and diplomatic achievements, emphasizing the importance of standing against terrorism.

title: Drug overdose? Medical PG student found dead in hostel room; was undergoing treatment for depression
content: Dr. Priya Karthika, a 27-year-old psychiatry PG student at Belagavi Institute of Medical Sciences (BIMS), tragically died by suicide on Monday. She allegedly consumed an overdose of medicine in her hostel room after completing her hospital duty. Dr. Karthika had a history of depression and had previously attempted suicide, receiving treatment in Bengaluru.

title: August rain fury: Mumbai reels under record showers; flights, local trains impacted
content: Mumbai grappled with severe disruptions due to relentless rainfall, triggering a red alert. The city experienced its wettest August in five years, surpassing average rainfall. Waterlogging, traffic chaos, and power outages plagued the region. Transportation networks faced major suspensions, with bus routes diverted and train services halted.

title: Delhi: Over 50 schools receive fresh bomb threats; â€˜Terrorizers 111â€™ group demands $25k
content: Over 50 schools in Delhi received bomb threat emails from 'Terrorizers 111', demanding USD 25,000 after a similar incident in August. The group claimed to have planted explosives and breached IT systems, threatening detonation if demands weren't met. Authorities are taking the threats seriously, evacuating schools and conducting thorough searches, despite previous threats being hoaxes.

title: Sophie Cunningham sparks laughter on podcast: Calls Gisele BÃ¼ndchen â€˜Gazelleâ€™
content: Sophie Cunningham, a WNBA player, faced backlash for making a joke about Gisele BÃ¼ndchen on her podcast while discussing Tom Brady's statue. The comments came amid reports that BÃ¼ndchen was upset with Brady's remarks about how his career influenced his parenting. The joke reignited public interest in their post-divorce relationship.

title: Asia Cup hockey: 'Security in India better', says official on Pak's withdrawal
content: Pakistan and Oman have withdrawn from the Hockey Asia Cup 2025 in India, citing security concerns, a claim dismissed by Indian officials. The tournament, crucial for 2026 World Cup qualification, will proceed with eight teams. India's hockey officials emphasize that security arrangements are robust and are focused on hosting a successful event despite the withdrawals.

title: Virat Kohli kissing Anushka Sharma's forehead at wedding was photographer's fav pic
content: Joseph Radhik, the photographer behind Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma's dreamy Tuscany wedding, reminisces about the experience. He highlights the couple's request for authentic, unretouched images and the overwhelming reach of his work, even to unexpected corners of India. While unfazed by Virat, Radhik admits being star-struck photographing Priyanka Chopra's wedding to Nick Jonas.

title: 'Please move on': Dhanashree Verma on ex-Yuzvendra's â€˜fake marriageâ€™ remark
content: Dhanashree Verma addressed Yuzvendra Chahal's remarks regarding their marriage. She cautioned against exploiting her silence. Dhanashree spoke about the social media criticism she faced post-divorce. She expressed optimism about her career and future prospects. Dhanashree hopes to find love again. She emphasized the importance of self-love while remaining open to new relationships.

title: Indians on H-1B: Where will they go if they lose jobs in the US?
content: For Indian professionals on H-1B and L-1 visas, the American dream is increasingly uncertain. Visa restrictions, sudden policy shifts, and political rhetoric are reshaping career and life choices. A Blind poll shows 45% would return to India if laid off, drawn by family, cultural ties, and tech opportunities, while regulatory changes and professional risks continue to complicate long-term planning.

title: 'I gotta see it': Patrick Mahomes recalls reaction to Travis Kelce, Taylor Swift relationship
content: Patrick Mahomes initially doubted Travis Kelce's relationship with Taylor Swift, needing to witness it to believe it. He acknowledged the increased buzz and attention Swift brought to the stadium. Mahomes also praised Swift's dedication to her new album, revealed on Kelce's podcast, as both athletes focus on their comeback after a Super Bowl loss.

title: Sexual violence against women: India calls out Pakâ€™s 'hypocrisy' at UN
content: At a UN Security Council debate, India's representative Eldos Mathew Punnoos accused Pakistan of historical and ongoing sexual violence, particularly against minority women, dating back to the 1971 conflict.

title: 'Game must go on': Wasim Akram gives opinion on India vs Pak match in Asia Cup
content: Pakistani cricket legend Wasim Akram emphasizes that the Asia Cup 2025 should proceed regardless of India's participation against Pakistan. Scheduled in Dubai and Abu Dhabi from September 9-28, the tournament features eight teams. Akram voices optimism for a future India-Pakistan Test series, advocating for focusing on sporting achievements and avoiding political tensions.

title: Who is Kairan Quazi? 16-year-old teen engineer leaving Elon Muskâ€™s SpaceX - Why?
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old prodigy, is transitioning from SpaceX's Starlink project to Citadel Securities as a quant developer. After graduating from Santa Clara University at 14, he defied age barriers at SpaceX. Now, he's set to apply his unique engineering and problem-solving skills to quantitative finance, overcoming challenges related to age-based biases in the professional world.

title: 'Successful strikes, not Mr Trump': Tharoor rebuts US President's mediation claim
content: Shashi Tharoor stated that Pakistan must dismantle terror networks before India considers repairing ties. He highlighted past attempts at outreach betrayed by Pakistani hostility. Tharoor recalled the 2008 Mumbai attacks and India's evidence of Pakistani involvement. He mentioned India's restraint giving way to surgical strikes. Tharoor cited France, Germany, US and Vietnam as examples of reconciliation.

title: Periye double murder convict granted parole despite opposition from victimsâ€™ families
content: The fourth accused has been granted a parole of one month, despite the objections raised by the Bekal police as well as the families of the victims

title: India celebrates clean energy milestone but coal still king
content: Coal is needed to fulfil power demands while storage capacity lags behind the surge in renewable sources of power

title: Passenger Reservation System can book 25,000 tickets per minute: Railway Minister
content: Capacity enhancement and technological upgradation is an ongoing process of Indian Railways. Presently, the booking capacity of the current PRS is about 25,000 tickets per minute, says Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Kintakuru encounter: Andhra Pradesh Government orders magisterial inquiry into killing of three Maoists
content: The police officials, family members of the deceased Maoists and doctors involved in the post-mortem are directed to appear for the inquiry to be held in Rampachodavaram on August 25

title: Parliament passes bill to set up IIM in Guwahati
content: The establishment of an IIM in Guwahati as an institution of national importance is one of the projects under the special development package provided to Assam

title: 8th accused held in Army jawan assault case at Meerut toll plaza
content: SP (Rural) Rakesh Kumar Mishra had earlier said that seven accused, identified as Sachin, Vijay, Anuj, Ankit, Suresh Rana, Ankit Sharma and Neeraj Talian alias Bittu, were arrested after CCTV footage analysis

title: 14th-century goddess idol found near Kodiveri anicut
content: The idol represents the Hindu goddess Nisumba Soodhani; it is said that the Cholas worshipped the deity before going to war

title: Rupee rises by 6 paise to close at 87.07 against U.S. dollar
content: Forex traders said easing tensions over trade tariffs and hopes of peace between Russia and Ukraine enthused investors.

title: Owaisi submits notice opposing three bills that enable removal of PM, CMs and other elected representatives
content: The [Union] government wants to turn country into a police state; it is a 1933 Gestapo moment for India: Owaisi

title: First flood warning issued for Godavari, 12 Koya tribal pockets downstream Bhadrachalam cut-off in A.P.
content: The inhabitants in the entire submergence area of the Polavaram irrigation project are put on alert in Andhra Pradesh

title: TVK supporter dies of electrocution near Srivilliputtur; flag pole falls at party conference venue in Madurai
content: The iron pole he was carrying touched the overhead cable when he was trying to erect a hoarding in connection with the TVK meet, scheduled to be held in Madurai

title: A strong hit of â€˜Captainâ€™ nostalgia
content: Hitting the screens again this Friday, Vijayakantâ€™s iconic 1991 film â€˜Captain Prabhakaranâ€™ became a blockbuster, and the moniker â€˜Captainâ€™ stuck with him forever

title: Telangana CM lays foundation stone for integrated registration offices; 63% revenue generated from 39 SROs in GHMC
content: Those obstructing plans to develop Hyderabad as international city would be construed as â€œenemiesâ€ of the State, says CM Revanth

title: What early issues need solving for some top Premier League clubs?
content: the first weekend of the premier league season is a momentous event, and teams spend months preparing for it . some of the country's best clubs struggled over the weekend and likely left their managers walking away with their brains full of possible tweaks and solutions . a measly 39% possession highlighted how difficult they found it to get on the ball .

title: MMA divisional rankings: Can any middleweight stop Khamzat Chimaev from taking top position?
content: Khamzat Chimaev becomes middleweight champion at the UFC 319 . he is undefeated and has long been expected to rise to the top . the middleweight rankings also saw two fighters enter the top 10 for the first time .

title: NFC East betting preview: Can anyone overtake the Eagles?
content: no team has won the NFC East in back-to-back seasons since 2001-04 . the Dallas Cowboys are the third choice at +700, followed by the New York Giants . defending champions are -160 to do just that, with the Washington Commanders next in line at +225 .

title: Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as one-stop shop for all of our best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot . it doesn't matter whether you have been doing this for years or are a first-timer .

title: The stat that could swing every team's 2025-26 season

title: CFB Player Rank: Who should've made the top 10? What were the biggest surprises?

title: Pegula-Draper, Ruud-Swiatek reach US Open semi
content: the revamped US Open mixed doubles tournament is down to its final four . the tournament has been criticized for everything from its format (shorter matches) to its field (only 16 teams) casper Ruud and Iga Swiatek will face the top-seeded duo of Jessica Pegula and Jack Draper in one semifinal .

title: Everything to know about the revamped -- and controversial -- US Open mixed doubles
content: the mixed doubles draw gets underway in new york on tuesday . the tournament features star-studded pairings, record prize money and a healthy dose of controversy . this edition runs concurrently with the main draw and the championship match is held during the final weekend .

title: Who comes in at No. 1? Ranking the top 100 college football players ahead of the 2025-26 season
content: a list of the top 10 college football players entering the season is no easy task . it requires a mix of information, reporting and assumptions . some choices are easy and some projections are nearly universally agreed upon . at least a few will be hisman Trophy contenders by season's end .

title: Updated top 100 MLB prospect rankings: There's a new No. 1
content: a lot has changed since the last time we ranked the top MLB prospects . some of the prospects on the list are in new places after a busy trade deadline . this is my ranking of these players for the long term, considering their upside, risk and proximity to the big leagues .

title: What do NFL scouts think of Arch Manning and what can Texas expect from him?
